- Colour coding boards/cards (and maybe other board-/card-specific styling? Eg automatic strikeouts for all cards on the "done" board.)

- Overall styling needs a few more tweaks (notably mv-add/mv-status don't quite fit in + the current colour scheme is boring) but that's pure style instead of functional style so comes after colour-coding.

- There's a bug where an empty card still gets counted but I don't think I care enough to fix that and I'm not even sure if it's a me-bug or a Mavo-bug or non-bug (empty card is still card after all) anyway.

- Can sometimes still technically edit one of the boards/some of the cards in it even after turning editing off, usually the last board/cards to have been edited. Also not sure if this is a me-bug or Mavo-bug but tbh suspect Mavo. Can't reliably replicate yet either way.
- Switch to non-local storage (tested with Dropbox and GitHub)

[Mavo](https://mavo.io/) exists, I wanted to try it out, Sortboards happened. (Opinion: not gonna be writing massive apps in Mavo but it's good for what it's meant for, ie turning a  HTML/CSS page into an editable/updateable one without extra backend work.)
Meant to be like rearranging index cards on a corkboard. Except without the corkboard, and with subboards to organize your cards.
